26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_AABB_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_AABB_H

29 // Libraries
30 #include <reactphysics3d/mathematics/mathematics.h>

33 namespace reactphysics3d {
34 
35 // Class AABB
42 class AABB {
43 
44  private :
45 
46  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
47 
49  Vector3 mMinCoordinates;
50 
52  Vector3 mMaxCoordinates;
53 
54  public :
55 
56  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
57 
59  AABB() = default;
60 
62  AABB(const Vector3& minCoordinates, const Vector3& maxCoordinates);
63 
65  Vector3 getCenter() const;
66 
68  const Vector3& getMin() const;
69 
71  void setMin(const Vector3& min);
72 
74  const Vector3& getMax() const;
75 
77  void setMax(const Vector3& max);
78 
80  Vector3 getExtent() const;
81 
83  void inflate(decimal dx, decimal dy, decimal dz);
84 
86  bool testCollision(const AABB& aabb) const;
87 
89  decimal getVolume() const;
90 
92  void mergeWithAABB(const AABB& aabb);
93 
95  void mergeTwoAABBs(const AABB& aabb1, const AABB& aabb2);
96 
98  bool contains(const AABB& aabb) const;

122 
123 // Return the center point of the AABB in world coordinates
124 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 AABB::getCenter() const {
125  return (mMinCoordinates + mMaxCoordinates) * decimal(0.5);
126 }
127 
128 // Return the minimum coordinates of the AABB
129 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const Vector3& AABB::getMin() const {
130  return mMinCoordinates;
131 }
132 
133 // Set the minimum coordinates of the AABB
134 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::setMin(const Vector3& min) {
135  mMinCoordinates = min;
136 }
137 
138 // Return the maximum coordinates of the AABB
139 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const Vector3& AABB::getMax() const {
140  return mMaxCoordinates;
141 }
142 
143 // Set the maximum coordinates of the AABB
144 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::setMax(const Vector3& max) {
145  mMaxCoordinates = max;
146 }
147 
148 // Return the size of the AABB in the three dimension x, y and z
149 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 AABB::getExtent() const {
150  return mMaxCoordinates - mMinCoordinates;
151 }
152 
153 // Inflate each side of the AABB by a given size
154 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::inflate(decimal dx, decimal dy, decimal dz) {
155  mMaxCoordinates += Vector3(dx, dy, dz);
156  mMinCoordinates -= Vector3(dx, dy, dz);
157 }
158 
159 // Return true if the current AABB is overlapping with the AABB in argument.
161 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::testCollision(const AABB& aabb) const {
162  if (mMaxCoordinates.x < aabb.mMinCoordinates.x ||
163  aabb.mMaxCoordinates.x < mMinCoordinates.x) return false;
164  if (mMaxCoordinates.y < aabb.mMinCoordinates.y ||
165  aabb.mMaxCoordinates.y < mMinCoordinates.y) return false;
166  if (mMaxCoordinates.z < aabb.mMinCoordinates.z||
167  aabb.mMaxCoordinates.z < mMinCoordinates.z) return false;
168  return true;
169 }
170 
171 // Return the volume of the AABB
172 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal AABB::getVolume() const {
173  const Vector3 diff = mMaxCoordinates - mMinCoordinates;
174  return (diff.x * diff.y * diff.z);
175 }
176 
177 // Return true if the AABB of a triangle intersects the AABB
178 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::testCollisionTriangleAABB(const Vector3* trianglePoints) const {
179 
180  if (min3(trianglePoints[0].x, trianglePoints[1].x, trianglePoints[2].x) > mMaxCoordinates.x) return false;
181  if (min3(trianglePoints[0].y, trianglePoints[1].y, trianglePoints[2].y) > mMaxCoordinates.y) return false;
182  if (min3(trianglePoints[0].z, trianglePoints[1].z, trianglePoints[2].z) > mMaxCoordinates.z) return false;
183 
184  if (max3(trianglePoints[0].x, trianglePoints[1].x, trianglePoints[2].x) < mMinCoordinates.x) return false;
185  if (max3(trianglePoints[0].y, trianglePoints[1].y, trianglePoints[2].y) < mMinCoordinates.y) return false;
186  if (max3(trianglePoints[0].z, trianglePoints[1].z, trianglePoints[2].z) < mMinCoordinates.z) return false;
187 
188  return true;
189 }
190 
191 // Return true if a point is inside the AABB
192 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::contains(const Vector3& point) const {
193 
194  return (point.x >= mMinCoordinates.x - MACHINE_EPSILON && point.x <= mMaxCoordinates.x + MACHINE_EPSILON &&
195  point.y >= mMinCoordinates.y - MACHINE_EPSILON && point.y <= mMaxCoordinates.y + MACHINE_EPSILON &&
196  point.z >= mMinCoordinates.z - MACHINE_EPSILON && point.z <= mMaxCoordinates.z + MACHINE_EPSILON);
197 }
198 
199 // Apply a scale factor to the AABB
200 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::applyScale(const Vector3& scale) {
201  mMinCoordinates = mMinCoordinates * scale;
202  mMaxCoordinates = mMaxCoordinates * scale;
203 }
204 
205 // Merge the AABB in parameter with the current one
206 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::mergeWithAABB(const AABB& aabb) {
207  mMinCoordinates.x = std::min(mMinCoordinates.x, aabb.mMinCoordinates.x);
208  mMinCoordinates.y = std::min(mMinCoordinates.y, aabb.mMinCoordinates.y);
209  mMinCoordinates.z = std::min(mMinCoordinates.z, aabb.mMinCoordinates.z);
210 
211  mMaxCoordinates.x = std::max(mMaxCoordinates.x, aabb.mMaxCoordinates.x);
212  mMaxCoordinates.y = std::max(mMaxCoordinates.y, aabb.mMaxCoordinates.y);
213  mMaxCoordinates.z = std::max(mMaxCoordinates.z, aabb.mMaxCoordinates.z);
214 }
215 
216 // Replace the current AABB with a new AABB that is the union of two AABBs in parameters
217 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void AABB::mergeTwoAABBs(const AABB& aabb1, const AABB& aabb2) {
218  mMinCoordinates.x = std::min(aabb1.mMinCoordinates.x, aabb2.mMinCoordinates.x);
219  mMinCoordinates.y = std::min(aabb1.mMinCoordinates.y, aabb2.mMinCoordinates.y);
220  mMinCoordinates.z = std::min(aabb1.mMinCoordinates.z, aabb2.mMinCoordinates.z);
221 
222  mMaxCoordinates.x = std::max(aabb1.mMaxCoordinates.x, aabb2.mMaxCoordinates.x);
223  mMaxCoordinates.y = std::max(aabb1.mMaxCoordinates.y, aabb2.mMaxCoordinates.y);
224  mMaxCoordinates.z = std::max(aabb1.mMaxCoordinates.z, aabb2.mMaxCoordinates.z);
225 }
226 
227 // Return true if the current AABB contains the AABB given in parameter
228 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::contains(const AABB& aabb) const {
229 
230  bool isInside = true;
231  isInside = isInside && mMinCoordinates.x <= aabb.mMinCoordinates.x;
232  isInside = isInside && mMinCoordinates.y <= aabb.mMinCoordinates.y;
233  isInside = isInside && mMinCoordinates.z <= aabb.mMinCoordinates.z;
234 
235  isInside = isInside && mMaxCoordinates.x >= aabb.mMaxCoordinates.x;
236  isInside = isInside && mMaxCoordinates.y >= aabb.mMaxCoordinates.y;
237  isInside = isInside && mMaxCoordinates.z >= aabb.mMaxCoordinates.z;
238  return isInside;
239 }
240 
241 // Create and return an AABB for a triangle
242 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE AABB AABB::createAABBForTriangle(const Vector3* trianglePoints) {
243 
244  Vector3 minCoords(trianglePoints[0].x, trianglePoints[0].y, trianglePoints[0].z);
245  Vector3 maxCoords(trianglePoints[0].x, trianglePoints[0].y, trianglePoints[0].z);
246 
247  if (trianglePoints[1].x < minCoords.x) minCoords.x = trianglePoints[1].x;
248  if (trianglePoints[1].y < minCoords.y) minCoords.y = trianglePoints[1].y;
249  if (trianglePoints[1].z < minCoords.z) minCoords.z = trianglePoints[1].z;
250 
251  if (trianglePoints[2].x < minCoords.x) minCoords.x = trianglePoints[2].x;
252  if (trianglePoints[2].y < minCoords.y) minCoords.y = trianglePoints[2].y;
253  if (trianglePoints[2].z < minCoords.z) minCoords.z = trianglePoints[2].z;
254 
255  if (trianglePoints[1].x > maxCoords.x) maxCoords.x = trianglePoints[1].x;
256  if (trianglePoints[1].y > maxCoords.y) maxCoords.y = trianglePoints[1].y;
257  if (trianglePoints[1].z > maxCoords.z) maxCoords.z = trianglePoints[1].z;
258 
259  if (trianglePoints[2].x > maxCoords.x) maxCoords.x = trianglePoints[2].x;
260  if (trianglePoints[2].y > maxCoords.y) maxCoords.y = trianglePoints[2].y;
261  if (trianglePoints[2].z > maxCoords.z) maxCoords.z = trianglePoints[2].z;
262 
263  return AABB(minCoords, maxCoords);
264 }
265 
266 // Return true if the ray intersects the AABB
267 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::testRayIntersect(const Vector3& rayOrigin, const Vector3& rayDirectionInverse, decimal rayMaxFraction) const {
268 
269  // This algorithm relies on the IEE floating point properties (division by zero). If the rayDirection is zero, rayDirectionInverse and
270  // therfore t1 and t2 will be +-INFINITY. If the i coordinate of the ray's origin is inside the AABB (mMinCoordinates[i] < rayOrigin[i] < mMaxCordinates[i)), we have
271  // t1 = -t2 = +- INFINITY. Since max(n, -INFINITY) = min(n, INFINITY) = n for all n, tMin and tMax will stay unchanged. Secondly, if the i
272  // coordinate of the ray's origin is outside the box (rayOrigin[i] < mMinCoordinates[i] or rayOrigin[i] > mMaxCoordinates[i]) we have
273  // t1 = t2 = +- INFINITY and therefore either tMin = +INFINITY or tMax = -INFINITY. One of those values will stay until the end and make the
274  // method to return false. Unfortunately, if the ray lies exactly on a slab (rayOrigin[i] = mMinCoordinates[i] or rayOrigin[i] = mMaxCoordinates[i]) we
275  // have t1 = (mMinCoordinates[i] - rayOrigin[i]) * rayDirectionInverse[i] = 0 * INFINITY = NaN which is a problem for the remaining of the algorithm.
276  // This will cause the method to return true when the ray is not intersecting the AABB and therefore cause to traverse more nodes than necessary in
277  // the BVH tree. Because this should be rare, it is not really a big issue.
278  // Reference: https://tavianator.com/2011/ray_box.html
279 
280  decimal t1 = (mMinCoordinates[0] - rayOrigin[0]) * rayDirectionInverse[0];
281  decimal t2 = (mMaxCoordinates[0] - rayOrigin[0]) * rayDirectionInverse[0];
282 
283  decimal tMin = std::min(t1, t2);
284  decimal tMax = std::max(t1, t2);
285  tMax = std::min(tMax, rayMaxFraction);
286 
287  for (int i = 1; i < 3; i++) {
288 
289  t1 = (mMinCoordinates[i] - rayOrigin[i]) * rayDirectionInverse[i];
290  t2 = (mMaxCoordinates[i] - rayOrigin[i]) * rayDirectionInverse[i];
291 
292  tMin = std::max(tMin, std::min(t1, t2));
293  tMax = std::min(tMax, std::max(t1, t2));
294  }
295 
296  return tMax >= std::max(tMin, decimal(0.0));
297 }
298 
299 // Compute the intersection of a ray and the AABB
300 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool AABB::raycast(const Ray& ray, Vector3& hitPoint) const {
301 
302  decimal tMin = decimal(0.0);
303  decimal tMax = DECIMAL_LARGEST;
304 
305  const decimal epsilon = decimal(0.00001);
306 
307  const Vector3 rayDirection = ray.point2 - ray.point1;
308 
309  // For all three slabs
310  for (int i=0; i < 3; i++) {
311 
312  // If the ray is parallel to the slab
313  if (std::abs(rayDirection[i]) < epsilon) {
314 
315  // If origin of the ray is not inside the slab, no hit
316  if (ray.point1[i] < mMinCoordinates[i] || ray.point1[i] > mMaxCoordinates[i]) return false;
317  }
318  else {
319 
320  decimal rayDirectionInverse = decimal(1.0) / rayDirection[i];
321  decimal t1 = (mMinCoordinates[i] - ray.point1[i]) * rayDirectionInverse;
322  decimal t2 = (mMaxCoordinates[i] - ray.point1[i]) * rayDirectionInverse;
323 
324  if (t1 > t2) {
325 
326  // Swap t1 and t2
327  decimal tTemp = t2;
328  t2 = t1;
329  t1 = tTemp;
330  }
331 
332  tMin = std::max(tMin, t1);
333  tMax = std::min(tMax, t2);
334 
335  // Exit with no collision
336  if (tMin > tMax) return false;
337  }
338  }
339 
340  // Compute the hit point
341  hitPoint = ray.point1 + tMin * rayDirection;
342 
343  return true;
344 }
345 
346 }
